page.title: 09EDUCATION IN LAMLASH.
page.content: Arran High School is the only secondary high school on the island with 280 fully attending pupils.During World War II the school was used for training commandos and a base for naval officers.The sports fields are at the back of the school where they trained.For a canteen they used Lamlash community hall.The school was finally opened after the war. A new art building has been erected which is phase one in the modernisation of Arran High School which is to be followed on by the construction of the new building.This building has taken the place of 7 temporary huts which were constucted in 1979 to accommodate for the rise in pupils.
